title: Best RTX 4070 Ti GPUs in 2024
description: Choose the right RTX 4070 Ti to play all your favorite games with.
author: Rich Edmonds
excerpt: Choose the right RTX 4070 Ti to play all your favorite games with.
text: When shopping around for one of the best mid-range graphics cards for playing games at 1440p resolutions, I'd recommend considering the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Ti. It's got everything Nvidia has to offer with its RTX 40 series of GPUs but costs considerably less than the RTX 4080 and above. Not only is this thing capable of outmatching previous generation cards of a higher tier, but it's also one of the best graphics cards to buy on a budget. Here are my favorite choices for an excellent RTX 4070 Ti gaming PC. Source: MSI MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G Best overall Source: PNY PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 Runner-up Source: Asus Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Best value Source: Best Buy Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 Best performance Source: Zotac ZOTAC Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC Best Design Our top picks for the RTX 4070 Ti GPU in 2024 Best overall MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G Our favorite RTX 4070 Ti GPUThe MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a monstrous GPU at a reasonable price. Rocking 12GB of VRAM, 7,680 CUDA Cores and a maximum boost clock speed of 2,745MHz, this is a solid gaming card for 4K.ProsExcellent performanceGood thermalsGreat for 4K gaming ConsPriceyStrong AMD competition The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a very capable mid-tier GPU with 7,680 CUDA cores, 12GB of GDDR6X VRAM, and a maximum clock speed of 2,760MHz through MSI Center or 2,745MHz in gaming or silent modes. The amount of VRAM available also makes these cards ideal for running more intensive games with plenty of high-resolution textures. This is especially applicable to more resource-intensive 4K gaming. Being part of the RTX 40 series of GPUs, this MSI card has the latest streaming multiprocessors, fourth-generation Tensor cores, and third-generation ray-tracing cores. We're talking two to four times the performance versus previous generation GPUs, depending on the workload. The RTX 40 series didn't have the best launches, and to this day, many aren't biting the upgrade bullet due to pricing, which is reflected by the MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G itself costing more than the MSRP. However, it's well worth it if your budget can stretch. Runner-up PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 Another excellent RTX 4070 Ti GPUThe PNY RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 is a brilliant graphics card for enjoying all your favorite games at higher resolutions. It packs a punch in both performance and design.ProsExcellent performanceRuns cool under loadCheaper than our top pick ConsStill priceySlower boost speeds PNY focuses on providing as much performance as possible without cranking the price up too high. The PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 is a more budget-orientated option for those on the hunt for an RTX 4070 Ti and, as such, usually costs less than other recommendations in our collection. This is largely due to the slower boost speeds, which are only able to hit 2,610MHz from the factory. Don't allow that to put you off, however, as this card still has 12GB of GDDR6X memory and ample performance for 4K gaming. So long as your power supply is able to reliably provide upwards of 300W to this GPU, you'll have a sizable grin on your face. Like many other RTX 4070 Ti aftermarket GPUs, the RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 from PNY features a tri-fan design for keeping the cores adequately cooled under load. Best value Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti The GPU that offers the best bang for your buckThe Asus TUF Gaming RTX 4070 Ti is one of the company's more affordable RTX 40 series graphics cards. It has enough power for 4K gaming, but doesn't cost as much as some of the other RTX 4070 Ti options.ProsBetter value compared to other optionsExcellent 1440p performance ConsStill a little priceyDesign isn't for everyone Asus doesn't typically find itself at the lower end of the price range for graphics cards, but the company's Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti is a rare sighting, coming in below most other RTX 4070 Ti GPUs. Costing just $820, this is still considerably more than what many would put the RTX 4070 Ti GPU at, but it's certainly more reasonable than those that cost beyond $900. Interestingly, it doesn't have the slowest clock speeds, with its boost profile capable of hitting 2,640MHz. Where this Asus TUF GPU may fall short for some is the design. Being industrial, it may not fit in with the PC build theme, but we're seeing older Zotac AMP! Extreme design vibes, and that's no complaint. Asus provides all the essentials with its TUF range of PC hardware, and this RTX 4070 Ti is no exception. Best performance Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 Amazing visuals and GPU performanceThe Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 delivers exceptional performance for the price and comes in a minimalist white design. ProsHigher clock speeds than other picksUnique RGB lighting ConsStill expensive for what you getRequires a big case Gigabyte makes some compelling hardware, and its Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 is one serious GPU. Not only is this thing massive, requiring a sizable PC case to contain the graphics card, but it's also incredibly potent for 1440p and some 4K gaming. Similar 12GB of VRAM and 7,680 CUDA cores are found inside this gorgeous white GPU, but the boost clock speeds are capable of hitting 2,640MHz, considerably higher than other cards, and that's before you do any tweaking yourself. Best Design ZOTAC Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC We ❤️ Zotac's latest GPU designsThe Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC is a GPU that not only looks from another dimension, but it has the performance to back up the visuals and offers solid 4K experiences.ProsExcellent performanceStriking design ConsPricey when compared to AMDBoost speeds aren't as high as other options We mentioned Zotac's older designs already, but if you want the real deal, check out the Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC. This is one good-looking GPU and matches the same design used for other Zotac cards. This GPU won't be boosting as high as some of the more expensive options, with its clock speeds limited to 2,610MHz from the factory, but you'll be gaming in style, no matter the PC case you're using — just make sure it has some tempered glass, so you can see the GPU in action. The cooling solution attached to the Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC is nothing short of incredible. No matter how much you throw at this GPU, it'll be able to smash through without so much as breaking a sweat. Best budget PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto For those seeking the cheapest RTX 4070 Ti cardsThe PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto is a very capable graphics card with enough performance to handle 4K gaming with settings conservatively set. Having access to DLSS and other Nvidia technologies make this a powerful gaming machine at a somewhat more reasonable price.ProsStill great performanceBetter price tag ConsBoost speeds aren't as high as other cards The most affordable RTX 4070 Ti is a strange string of words to throw together but the PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto is one of the best priced in terms of value. Being an RTX 4070 GPU, it's about as good as any other card of the same family but being slightly more affordable than PNY's other options, you will find this GPU has slightly slower clock speeds. It will boost to around 2,610MHz, but this alongside the 12GB of VRAM and other components will ensure you have a smooth gaming experience. Best compact MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X White 12G OC This GPU will fit inside most PC casesThe MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X is a smaller version of this powerful mid-range graphics card. It has two large fans, a smaller footprint, and should be able to fit inside smaller PC systems. It's as good as most other RTX 4070 Ti cards for gaming at 1440p.ProsCompact sizeSame RTX 4070 Ti performance ConsWeaker overclocking potentialRuns warmer than other 4070 Ti cards Not everyone has the luxury of using a full tower PC case for building their dream system, which is where my MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X White 12G OC recommendation comes into play. This mighty GPU is perfect for playing all your favorite games at 1080p and 1440p resolutions, with the capability of moving into 4K should you turn down a setting or a few. The design is also more subtle than other "gamer" inspired graphics cards with zero RGB lighting and a clean white aesthetic. It'll run well under load and look the part inside just about any PC setup. Buying the best RTX 4070 Ti GPU When it comes to picking the very best aftermarket RTX 4070 Ti graphics card, you won't be disappointed with any of our recommendations here. They all boost accordingly and have the same Nvidia GPU at their heart, meaning the differences in performance largely boil down to the cooler and other design elements, allowing you to get as much out of the card as possible. The MSRP for the RTX 4070 Ti is $800, though one can always expect to pay more for aftermarket GPUs from Nvidia partners. The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is our go-to choice for the RTX 4070 Ti. It strikes a good balance between design, functionality, and performance. Whilst not the cheapest, nor the fastest RTC 4070 Ti out there, it's a good middle ground against all the other RTX 4070 Ti cards. For those who want to save as much as possible on an RTX 4070 Ti GPU, we'd recommend considering the excellent Asus TUF Gaming RTX 4070 Ti OC with its slightly more affordable price tag. Wondering what the difference is between the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 vs. RTX 4070 Ti? Our in-depth comparison will lend a hand by showing all the notable differences (and similarities) between the two graphics cards. Best overall MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a monstrous GPU at a reasonable price. Rocking 12GB of VRAM, 7,680 CUDA Cores and a maximum boost clock speed of 2,745MHz, this is a solid gaming card for 4K.
html:
When shopping around for one of the best mid-range graphics cards for playing games at 1440p resolutions, I'd recommend considering the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Ti. It's got everything Nvidia has to offer with its RTX 40 series of GPUs but costs considerably less than the RTX 4080 and above. Not only is this thing capable of outmatching previous generation cards of a higher tier, but it's also one of the best graphics cards to buy on a budget. Here are my favorite choices for an excellent RTX 4070 Ti gaming PC.

  • Source: MSI

    MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G

    Best overall

  • Source: PNY

    PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8

    Runner-up

  • Source: Asus

    Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti

    Best value

  • Source: Best Buy

    Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2

    Best performance

  • Source: Zotac

    ZOTAC Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC

    Best Design

Our top picks for the RTX 4070 Ti GPU in 2024

Best overall

MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G

Our favorite RTX 4070 Ti GPU

The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a monstrous GPU at a reasonable price. Rocking 12GB of VRAM, 7,680 CUDA Cores and a maximum boost clock speed of 2,745MHz, this is a solid gaming card for 4K.

Pros

  • Excellent performance
  • Good thermals
  • Great for 4K gaming

Cons

  • Pricey
  • Strong AMD competition

The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a very capable mid-tier GPU with 7,680 CUDA cores, 12GB of GDDR6X VRAM, and a maximum clock speed of 2,760MHz through MSI Center or 2,745MHz in gaming or silent modes. The amount of VRAM available also makes these cards ideal for running more intensive games with plenty of high-resolution textures. This is especially applicable to more resource-intensive 4K gaming.

Being part of the RTX 40 series of GPUs, this MSI card has the latest streaming multiprocessors, fourth-generation Tensor cores, and third-generation ray-tracing cores. We're talking two to four times the performance versus previous generation GPUs, depending on the workload. The RTX 40 series didn't have the best launches, and to this day, many aren't biting the upgrade bullet due to pricing, which is reflected by the MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G itself costing more than the MSRP. However, it's well worth it if your budget can stretch.

Runner-up

PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8

Another excellent RTX 4070 Ti GPU

The PNY RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 is a brilliant graphics card for enjoying all your favorite games at higher resolutions. It packs a punch in both performance and design.

Pros

  • Excellent performance
  • Runs cool under load
  • Cheaper than our top pick

Cons

  • Still pricey
  • Slower boost speeds

PNY focuses on providing as much performance as possible without cranking the price up too high. The PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 is a more budget-orientated option for those on the hunt for an RTX 4070 Ti and, as such, usually costs less than other recommendations in our collection. This is largely due to the slower boost speeds, which are only able to hit 2,610MHz from the factory. Don't allow that to put you off, however, as this card still has 12GB of GDDR6X memory and ample performance for 4K gaming.

So long as your power supply is able to reliably provide upwards of 300W to this GPU, you'll have a sizable grin on your face. Like many other RTX 4070 Ti aftermarket GPUs, the RTX 4070 Ti XLR8 from PNY features a tri-fan design for keeping the cores adequately cooled under load.

Best value

Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti

The GPU that offers the best bang for your buck

The Asus TUF Gaming RTX 4070 Ti is one of the company's more affordable RTX 40 series graphics cards. It has enough power for 4K gaming, but doesn't cost as much as some of the other RTX 4070 Ti options.

Pros

  • Better value compared to other options
  • Excellent 1440p performance

Cons

  • Still a little pricey
  • Design isn't for everyone

Asus doesn't typically find itself at the lower end of the price range for graphics cards, but the company's Asus TUF GAMING GeForce RTX 4070 Ti is a rare sighting, coming in below most other RTX 4070 Ti GPUs. Costing just $820, this is still considerably more than what many would put the RTX 4070 Ti GPU at, but it's certainly more reasonable than those that cost beyond $900. Interestingly, it doesn't have the slowest clock speeds, with its boost profile capable of hitting 2,640MHz.

Where this Asus TUF GPU may fall short for some is the design. Being industrial, it may not fit in with the PC build theme, but we're seeing older Zotac AMP! Extreme design vibes, and that's no complaint. Asus provides all the essentials with its TUF range of PC hardware, and this RTX 4070 Ti is no exception.

Best performance

Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2

Amazing visuals and GPU performance

The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 delivers exceptional performance for the price and comes in a minimalist white design. 

Pros

  • Higher clock speeds than other picks
  • Unique RGB lighting

Cons

  • Still expensive for what you get
  • Requires a big case

Gigabyte makes some compelling hardware, and its Gigabyte GeForce RTX 4070 Ti AERO OC V2 is one serious GPU. Not only is this thing massive, requiring a sizable PC case to contain the graphics card, but it's also incredibly potent for 1440p and some 4K gaming. Similar 12GB of VRAM and 7,680 CUDA cores are found inside this gorgeous white GPU, but the boost clock speeds are capable of hitting 2,640MHz, considerably higher than other cards, and that's before you do any tweaking yourself.

Best Design

ZOTAC Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC

We ❤️ Zotac's latest GPU designs

The Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC is a GPU that not only looks from another dimension, but it has the performance to back up the visuals and offers solid 4K experiences.

Pros

  • Excellent performance
  • Striking design

Cons

  • Pricey when compared to AMD
  • Boost speeds aren't as high as other options

We mentioned Zotac's older designs already, but if you want the real deal, check out the Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC. This is one good-looking GPU and matches the same design used for other Zotac cards. This GPU won't be boosting as high as some of the more expensive options, with its clock speeds limited to 2,610MHz from the factory, but you'll be gaming in style, no matter the PC case you're using — just make sure it has some tempered glass, so you can see the GPU in action.

The cooling solution attached to the Zotac Gaming GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Trinity OC is nothing short of incredible. No matter how much you throw at this GPU, it'll be able to smash through without so much as breaking a sweat.

Best budget

PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto

For those seeking the cheapest RTX 4070 Ti cards

The PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto is a very capable graphics card with enough performance to handle 4K gaming with settings conservatively set. Having access to DLSS and other Nvidia technologies make this a powerful gaming machine at a somewhat more reasonable price.

Pros

  • Still great performance
  • Better price tag

Cons

  • Boost speeds aren't as high as other cards

The most affordable RTX 4070 Ti is a strange string of words to throw together but the PNY GeForce RTX 4070 Ti Verto is one of the best priced in terms of value. Being an RTX 4070 GPU, it's about as good as any other card of the same family but being slightly more affordable than PNY's other options, you will find this GPU has slightly slower clock speeds. It will boost to around 2,610MHz, but this alongside the 12GB of VRAM and other components will ensure you have a smooth gaming experience.

Best compact

MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X White 12G OC

This GPU will fit inside most PC cases

The MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X is a smaller version of this powerful mid-range graphics card. It has two large fans, a smaller footprint, and should be able to fit inside smaller PC systems. It's as good as most other RTX 4070 Ti cards for gaming at 1440p.

Pros

  • Compact size
  • Same RTX 4070 Ti performance

Cons

  • Weaker overclocking potential
  • Runs warmer than other 4070 Ti cards

Not everyone has the luxury of using a full tower PC case for building their dream system, which is where my MSI Gaming RTX 4070 Ti Ventus 2X White 12G OC recommendation comes into play. This mighty GPU is perfect for playing all your favorite games at 1080p and 1440p resolutions, with the capability of moving into 4K should you turn down a setting or a few. The design is also more subtle than other "gamer" inspired graphics cards with zero RGB lighting and a clean white aesthetic. It'll run well under load and look the part inside just about any PC setup.

Buying the best RTX 4070 Ti GPU

When it comes to picking the very best aftermarket RTX 4070 Ti graphics card, you won't be disappointed with any of our recommendations here. They all boost accordingly and have the same Nvidia GPU at their heart, meaning the differences in performance largely boil down to the cooler and other design elements, allowing you to get as much out of the card as possible. The MSRP for the RTX 4070 Ti is $800, though one can always expect to pay more for aftermarket GPUs from Nvidia partners.

The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is our go-to choice for the RTX 4070 Ti. It strikes a good balance between design, functionality, and performance. Whilst not the cheapest, nor the fastest RTC 4070 Ti out there, it's a good middle ground against all the other RTX 4070 Ti cards. For those who want to save as much as possible on an RTX 4070 Ti GPU, we'd recommend considering the excellent Asus TUF Gaming RTX 4070 Ti OC with its slightly more affordable price tag. Wondering what the difference is between the Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 vs. RTX 4070 Ti? Our in-depth comparison will lend a hand by showing all the notable differences (and similarities) between the two graphics cards.

Best overall

MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G

The MSI RTX 4070 Ti Gaming X Trio 12G is a monstrous GPU at a reasonable price. Rocking 12GB of VRAM, 7,680 CUDA Cores and a maximum boost clock speed of 2,745MHz, this is a solid gaming card for 4K.
